FacilityName: City of Monett Wastewater Treatment Facility

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Monett WWTF is a municipaly owned and operated wastewater treatment facility.
The effluent from this facility is no longer chlorinated / dechlorinated. UV disinfection is used.
Chlorine is still stored on site in 150# cylinders for transport to various city drinking water wells.

This facility has had no reportable incidents since it went on line in 1978.

The risk posed by this facility to the community is possible exposure to chlorine gas due to accidental release due to damaged cylinder.

The city has an in house safety council to discuss and remedy any safety concerns for all departments.
WWTF personnel are required to have 30 hrs of refresher training every year of which chlorine safety is included.
WWTF personnel are State of Missouri certified operators.
WWTF personnel have had training in cylinder repair, SCBA, First Aid and CPR.
WWTF personnel are required to read, understand and follow ERP and SOP.

EQUIPMENT
Proper equipment is used for handling of chemicals.

SOP
Standard operating procedures are in a written format that is easy to read and follow.
Procedures dictate how to perform tasks in a safe manner.
Damaged, leaking or suspicious containers are not accepted.


EMERGENCY RESPONSE
The city police, fire and utility depts currently work with the ambulance district , hospital and LEPC on disaster preparedness.
The fire dept has A level responders for emergency situations.

UPDATE
The city's water dept storage facility was removed and its inventory moved to WWTF to decrease the number of storage sites to one location.
The latest expansion at the WWTF has eliminated the storage and use of ton cylinders.
